body_html: @alsrgv @soumith Actually this is something that shouldn't happen often. We set on worker processes daemon=True, so if they are not blocked, they should exit when parent process exit... So I'm curious what @alsrgv 's setting is. Usually data loader workers shouldn't use cuda memory as well.
body_text: @alsrgv @soumith Actually this is something that shouldn't happen often. We set on worker processes daemon=True, so if they are not blocked, they should exit when parent process exit... So I'm curious what @alsrgv 's setting is. Usually data loader workers shouldn't use cuda memory as well.
body: @alsrgv @soumith Actually this is something that shouldn't happen often. We set on worker processes `daemon=True`, so if they are not blocked, they should exit when parent process exit... So I'm curious what @alsrgv 's setting is. Usually data loader workers shouldn't use cuda memory as well.
